title: Countries with the fastest growing economies from 2001 to 2010
yAxis: Annual average GDP growth in percent
summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Annual average GDP growth in percent in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent 11.1 is found at Country Angola and the minimum is found at Rwanda where Country is 7.6.
The highest Country Angola has 3.5 more Annual average GDP growth in percent than the lowest Country Rwanda.

Country Angola has the highest Annual average GDP growth in percent and Rwanda has the lowest Annual average GDP growth in percent.

max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Annual average GDP growth in percent in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Annual average GDP growth in percent 11.1 is found at Country Angola and the minimum is found at Rwanda where Country is 7.6.
Country China has the second highest value for Annual average GDP growth in percent.
The difference of Annual average GDP growth in percent between the highest and lowest Country is 3.5.
Annual average GDP growth in percent at Country Angola is 11.1 , second place is China at 10.5, and thirdly is Myanmar at 10.3.
Country Chad, and Mozambique have the same Annual average GDP growth in percent.
The Country Angola has 1.25 times more Annual average GDP growth in percent than average.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 88.5.
